question_sentence: The canine equivalent of the Olympics took place in New York City this week. What was the competition called?
evidence: Thousands of dogs participated in the Westminster Dog Show. A petit basset griffon Vendéen named Buddy Holly became the first of his breed to win the prestigious contest’s top prize.

question_sentence: People around the world showed their support for World Lupus Day by wearing which color?
evidence: Many people around the world wore purple on Wednesday in honor of World Lupus Day, a global annual event that calls attention to the mysterious disease impacting more than 5 million people in the US alone.

question_sentence: Following years of speculation, which popular 1980s film finally has a sequel in the works?
evidence: Speculation has been swirling for years about a potential sequel to the 1988 film “Beetlejuice.” Now, it’s official: The “ghost with the most” will make a return.

question_sentence: The expiration of Title 42 means which border policy will be back in effect?
evidence: The lifting of Title 42 means that the US government will return to a decades-old section of the US code known as Title 8, which Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas has warned would carry “more severe” consequences for migrants found to be entering the country unlawfully.

question_sentence: FDA advisers this week voted unanimously in support of making which type of medication available over-the-counter for the first time in the US?
evidence: Advisers for the FDA voted unanimously on Wednesday in support of making a birth-control pill named Opill available over-the-counter, saying the benefits outweigh the risks.

question_sentence: The US opened an embassy this week in which Pacific island nation?
evidence: The US opened an embassy in the Pacific island nation of Tonga on Tuesday, Washington’s latest move to broaden its diplomatic footprint in a region where China has been increasing its influence in recent years.

question_sentence: The CDC declared measles was eliminated from the US in 2000. However, a new case was reported this week in which state?
evidence: A child in Maine has tested positive for measles, state health officials said. While the virus was declared eliminated more than two decades ago, health officials say vaccination rates in the US have dropped in recent years, sparking new outbreaks.

question_sentence: How many Peloton bikes were recalled this week over a potential safety hazard?
evidence: The US Consumer Product Safety Commission recalled 2 million Peloton bikes due to a safety hazard caused by the adjustable seat that could break during use and injure the rider.

question_sentence: Which university’s football team declined an invitation this week to the White House?
evidence: The Georgia Bulldogs football team declined an invitation to visit the White House next month to celebrate their second consecutive national championship, saying “the date suggested is not feasible given the student-athlete calendar and time of year.”

question_sentence: Which highly anticipated Netflix show is halting filming due to the film and TV writers’ strike?
evidence: Plans for filming the fifth and final season of “Stranger Things” has been paused due to the writers’ strike, the show’s co-creators announced.

question_sentence: The Beatles song “Here Comes the Sun” surpassed 1 million streams on Spotify Tuesday. All of these hits have also surpassed that tally except:
choices: “One Dance” by Drake, Wizkid and Kyla

question_sentence: The NFL announced its inaugural game on Black Friday will feature the revamped New York Jets hosting which team?
Federal prosecutors this week charged Rep. George Santos with which of the following:
True or false: This week marked the first time a Petit Basset Griffon Vendéen won best in show at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show.
The U.S. Senate confirmed confirmed historian and political scientist Colleen Shogan to head which federal agency?
An FDA panel unanimously recommended making a drug known as Opill available over the counter. What type of medication is it?
Billionaire Elon Musk announced this week he has picked a new leader and will step down as CEO of what company?
The federal government's COVID-19 national public health emergency formally came to an end this week. When was it first declared?
West Virginia suspended men's basketball coach Bob Huggins for three games and cut his salary after he did what?
choices: Used a homophobic slur on the radio
Told a player to fake an injury

question_sentence: Warner Bros. this week announced that the long-awaited sequel to this beloved movie starring Michael Keaton will hit theaters in 2024:
Which Hollywood star has become a father again at the age of 79?
evidence: The actor revealed this week that he and his girlfriend, martial arts instructor Tiffany Chen, were celebrating the birth of their daughter, Gia Virginia Chen-De Niro. He has six other children, whose ages range in age from 11 to 51.

question_sentence: Experts estimate that how many of around two million Britons with long Covid are in need of specialist care?
evidence: According to The Mirror, experts at the UK’s first long Covid clinic, at University College Hospital London, estimate that hundreds of thousands of patients are in need of specialist care for ailments ranging from severe fatigue to brain fog. But “so far only 100,000 have been offered treatment”, the paper reported.

question_sentence: A mysterious upcoming book that became a bestseller amid rumours that it was Taylor Swift’s memoir was actually written by which other music stars?
evidence: The guessing game began last week when the book appeared on multiple bookseller websites under the name 4C Untitled Flatiron Nonfiction Summer 2023. But publishing house Flatiron Books has solved the mystery by revealing that the eagerly anticipated release is about the K-pop boyband and will be published in July under the title Beyond the Story: 10-Year Record of BTS.

question_sentence: A new study found that which UK city is the “gloomiest” in the UK?
evidence: Research by Betway found that the West Yorkshire city was the least sunny in the UK, followed by. Blackpool and Aberdeen.

question_sentence: Polling suggests that what percentage of Americans think Joe Biden does not have the “mental sharpness” to serve a second term as president?
evidence: The Washington Post/ABC poll of more than 1,000 people found that 43% believed that 80-year-old Biden and Donald Trump, 76, are both too old to serve another term. If Biden is re-elected in 2024, he would be 82 when he takes office and 86 when his second term ends.

question_sentence: Newly released figures show that which UK airport was the worst for delays last year?
evidence: The airport was the worst for a second year in a row, with flights in 2022 leaving half an hour behind schedule on average. East Midlands Airport was the top performer, with average delays of just 13 minutes, while the UK average was 23 minutes, according to data from the Civil Aviation Authority.

question_sentence: On what grounds has Egypt’s Ministry of Tourism of Antiquities criticised new Netflix docuseries Queen Cleopatra?
choices: The series was filmed in Spain
evidence: Egypt’s Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities released a statement emphasising that “Queen Cleopatra had light skin and Hellenistic (Greek) features”, and criticising Netflix for casting British actor Adele James, who “possesses African features and dark skin”. Find out more on the latest episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Scientists in the Alps and the Arctic have discovered microbes that can eat what at cool temperatures?
evidence: Many microorganisms can digest plastic at temperatures above 30C, but the discovery by researchers at the Swiss Federal Institute paves the way for a much more energy-efficient method of recycling.

question_sentence: Who was named sportswoman of the year at the 2023 Laureus World Sports Awards?
evidence: The 36-year-old Jamaican sprinter beat a field that included swimmer Katie Ledecky, tennis star Iga Świątek and 400m hurdles record-holder Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone. Lionel Messi was named sportsman of the year at the awards in Paris on Monday.

question_sentence: Pupils at an independent school in North London have voted to make what change to their lunches?
choices: New option to order fast food
evidence: North London Collegiate School will trial dishes such as Chinese-style noodles with teriyaki grasshopper, sweet chilli and lime crickets, and Mexican rice topped with buffalo worms.
